reviews.text: This is just a ice cream stalls with kids play areas. Five type of play areas for kids with free unlimited quantity of the limited available flavours of ice creams in each areas. Overhyped tourist attraction with nothing for an adult tourist. Definitely not worth for the money paid to visit this tourist attraction.

Brought my boys for a sweet escape where they could recharge and discharge all their energy — and we ended up spending a joyful 𝟑 𝐟𝐮𝐥𝐥 𝐡𝐨𝐮𝐫𝐬 exploring!

We indulged in 𝐔𝐍𝐋𝐈𝐌𝐈𝐓𝐄𝐃 𝐢𝐜𝐞 𝐜𝐫𝐞𝐚𝐦 (seasonal flavors) (yes, really!) with treats in 𝟓 𝐝𝐢𝐟𝐟𝐞𝐫𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐬𝐭𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬 from Denzy, Ben & Jerry’s, and more — plus surprise popcorn station too!

The place is bursting with 𝐈𝐧𝐬𝐭𝐚𝐠𝐫𝐚𝐦𝐦𝐚𝐛𝐥𝐞 𝐬𝐩𝐨𝐭𝐬, laughter, and sugar-filled smiles.

it’s just that you have to drive in or take cab going here 🫣

Spacious in each room!

An obviously over hyped spot with a pricey entrance ticket they won’t accept cash. Remember if you are going as a group you can’t mix premium and standard tickets in the same bookings, they will ask to upgrade the standard to premium in spot. Not well connected with the metro and you got to relay on taxis. The themed rooms were picturesque whereas the taste of the ice cream was nothing special. Even though it is unlimited ice cream you won’t be in position to eat much due to the design of the menu and the place. The sprinkler pit was enjoyable but if you miss your belongings the employees will not definitely not help you as they have already mentioned. Be care with your mobiles, wallets and any other valuables while entering the pit. It’s a uni directional museum where one can’t re enter the past rooms.

The Museum of Ice Cream Singapore is an absolute blast and easily earns a 5-star rating! From the moment you step into this pink paradise, you're transported to a world of pure joy and sugary delight. It's not just a museum; it's an experience that engages all your senses and leaves you with a huge smile.
* Immersive and Whimsical Exhibits: Each room is a unique and incredibly Instagrammable adventure. You'll find yourself playing with giant scoops, swinging on banana swings, and of course, diving into the iconic sprinkle pool! The creativity and attention to detail in each installation are fantastic.
* Unlimited Ice Cream Treats: Throughout the museum, there are various stations offering a delightful array of flavors and treats. From classic scoops to local favorites like Potong ice cream, there's something to satisfy every sweet tooth. They even cater to dietary restrictions with vegan and allergen-friendly options.
* Fun for All Ages: Whether you're visiting with kids, friends, or even solo, the Museum of Ice Cream has something for everyone. The playful activities and vibrant atmosphere bring out the inner child in everyone.
* Engaging and Friendly Staff: The staff members are enthusiastic and add to the overall fun. They guide you through the experience, offer ice cream, and encourage you to participate in the activities.
* Unique Photo Opportunities: If you love taking pictures, this is your dream come true. Every corner is a photo opportunity, from the bright pink walls to the quirky props and installations.
Great place to visit, worthwhile the time and ticket, spend a enjoyable 2hrs in there enjoying the arena, multiple serving and different type/taste of ice cream. Definitely a must go place.
